technical_features.source_sentence: CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show a long operation lifetime (T95 at 1000 nits up to 8700 h).
Red QD films fully preserve their PLQYs at various stages of patterning.

technical_features.feature_name: Photostability Remnant PLQY (Red QDs under 500 mJ cm⁻² UV)
technical_features.source_sentence: CELS-treated QD films show notably higher remnant PLQYs over pristine samples (red, 82% and 97%).
The finest features are ∼4 μm, as shown in the line patterns.
XPS analysis shows that the molar ratio of Cl and Zn atoms (Cl/Zn) on the QD surfaces is 0.19.
Ligand coverage was about 3.4 nm⁻² [...] CELS removed about 40% of the OA ligands [...] resultant ligand coverage (∼2.0 nm⁻²).
Line edge roughness (LER) analysis suggests a LER of 100 nm.
Heavy-metal-free QDs still maintain ∼90% (for red and green) and 70% (for blue) of the original PLQYs after CELS.
DFT calculation [...] shows trap-state-free band gaps for ZnAc and ZnAcCl surface models.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Develop a direct photopatterning method (CELS) for quantum dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) that maintains high efficiency and stability comparable to non-patterned devices.
key_methodology_summary: Light-triggered carbocation generation from TPCl under UV
Ligand stripping via carbocation reaction with native QD ligands
Surface defect passivation by chloride anions
primary_findings_conclusions: 4μm patterning resolution with 100nm line edge roughness
Preserved PLQYs (75-97%) and enhanced photostability in patterned QDs
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Application in high-definition displays and wearable AR/VR
novelty_significance_claim: First patterning method achieving performance parity between patterned/non-patterned QLEDs
Dual-function photochemistry: ligand stripping + surface passivation
Universal applicability to Cd-based and heavy-metal-free QDs
